definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc/vegetarian diet/study room/building/to give alms (to a monk)

sentences.english: There among that dusty disorder, would you care to play hide - and - seek ?
sentences.chinese: 灰塵鋪滿零亂的書齋，歌兒呵，你可願在那裏捉迷藏？

sentences.english: Disciple Hong Fu asked me to give her study a name and write calligraphy for it.
sentences.chinese: 弟子虹福請我爲她的書齋取個名併爲之手書翰墨。

sentences.english: He took them and went into his study.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起兩封書函，走進那書齋。

sentences.english: A scholar belong in his study.
The fields his study, nature was his book.
Gerasim opened one blind, and went out of the room on tiptoe.
sentences.chinese: 格拉西姆打開一扇護窗板，踮着足走出了書齋。

sentences.english: Lightly smile, he trod into studio.

definition: to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc/vegetarian diet/study room/building/to give alms (to a monk)
form of writing novels that comprise lots of poetry in the body of the text, popular in the Ming Dynasty
(literary) things other than the bare necessities of life/item of some value/Taiwan pr. [zhang4 wu4]
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
Longquanyi district of Chengdu city 成都市[Cheng2 du1 shi4], Sichuan/Longquan county level city in Lishui 麗水|丽水[Li2 shui3], Zhejiang
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
